data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD drops towards $1,900 on firmer US Dollar, mixed sentiment
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) holds lower grounds as sellers attack a short-term key support line near $1,920 heading into Tuesday's European session. In doing so, the precious metal reverses the mid-Asian session's corrective bounce off the stated trend line support.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD rebounds on China data, International Monetary Fund growth projections
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) licks its wounds around $1,925 after a three-day downtrend as market sentiment improves during early Tuesday. The reason could be linked to China's official activity data and the upbeat growth forecasts from the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD declines toward $1,920 as Fed looks set to hike interest rates further
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is scaling downside towards the immediate support of $1,920.00 in the Asian session. The precious metal has been displaying a topsy-turvy move amid rising traction for the US Dollar Index (DXY) ahead of the interest rate decision by the Federal Reserve (Fed), which is scheduled for Wednesday.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls could emerge ahead of Federal Reserve
data.text: The Gold price has drifted lower for a third day and is testing structure as we head towards key events this week, including the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank as the key events, the Bank of England and also the United States of America jobs data. The Gold price is down some 0.29%  so far having lost territory from a high of $1,934.56 and running into a low of $1,920.74 so far.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD seesaws around $1,920s with traders bracing for US FOMC's decision
data.text: Gold price trades mostly sideways due to investors preparing for the US Federal Reserve Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting, which will begin on Tuesday. Most analysts estimate the US Federal Reserve (Fed) would increase rates by 25 bps, though they will be looking for cues about future meetings.

data.title: Gold Price Outlook: XAU/USD Bulls Tamed by Psychological Resistance
data.text: Gold prices gapped higher on this week's open, fueling bullish momentum. However, after retesting $1,950, prices have eased.

data.title: Gold at all-time highs in Euro and GBP – Report
data.text: Gold is always fun to analyse. But right now, it is particularly intriguing, what with all the chaos in the world economy and a spiralling cost-of-living crisis.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD consolidates in a range, awaits key central bank meetings
data.text: Gold price kicks off the new week on a subdued note and oscillates in a narrow trading band through the mid-European session. Currently placed around the $1,925 region, the XAU/USD remains confined within Friday's trading range as investors await this week's key central bank event risks before placing fresh directional bets.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD weakness hinges on $1,920 breakdown, Fed's verdict – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) stays defensive around $1,930, printing mild gains heading into Monday's European session, as traders begin the key week comprising the Federal Reserve's (Fed) monetary policy and the US employment data for January. Adding strength to the cautious optimism of the XAU/USD traders could be China's return from one-week-long holidays, as well as hopes of a dovish hike from the Fed and downbeat Nonfarm Payrolls (NFP).

data.title: Gold Futures: Rebound likely near term
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted traders scaled back their open interest positions for the second session in a row on Friday, this time by around 11.4K contracts. Volume followed suit and shrank by around 58.8K contracts.

data.title: EUR/USD At Risk of A Downside Correction, Gold Price Consolidates
data.text: The Euro made another attempt to clear the 1.0920 and 1.0925 resistance levels against the US Dollar. EUR/USD seems to be struggling to clear the 1.0925 barrier.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD stays defensive above $1,920 support as US Dollar steadies ahead of Fed, NFP
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) aptly portrays the market's cautious mood ahead of top-tier data/events during early Monday.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD senses hurdles around $1,930 as market mood sours, yields extend gains
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) has sensed barricades while attempting to cross the critical resistance of $1,930.00 in the Asian session. The precious metal has witnessed selling interest as investors are turning risk averse in the interest rate policy week.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears await Federal Reserve decision, United States Non-farm Payrolls
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) holds lower ground near $1,925 after posting an indecisive weekly closing as the metal traders await the key United States data and the Federal Reserve's (Fed) monetary policy decision. Also important will be central bank meetings of the European Central Bank (ECB), Purchasing Managers' Indexes data and the US employment numbers for January.

data.title: United States CFTC Gold NC Net Positions increased to $157.7K from previous $153.2K
data.text: United States CFTC Gold NC Net Positions increased to $157.7K from previous $153.2K

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD slips below $1930 after US PCE and UoM Consumer Sentiment
data.text: Gold price falls for the second consecutive day, but it remains above January's 26 low of $1,918.74 and stays sideways, following the release of inflation data in the United States (US). The US Dollar (USD) shortened its drop during the week, while US Treasury bond yields are rising, two additional reasons behind Gold's loss of its brightness.

data.title: Gold Finds Resistance at $1950!
data.text: Gold price retreated from the $1,950 handle, which is the highest level since April 2022. Modest Dollar strength weighed on the yellow metal as the DXY found some support.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD remains on the defensive around $1,925 ahead of US PCE
data.text: Gold price trades with a mild negative bias for the second successive day on Friday and hovers around the $1,925 region during the early European session. The intraday downtick, however, lacks follow-through, warranting some caution before positioning for a deeper corrective pullback from a nine-month peak touched the previous day.

data.title: Gold Futures: Downside seems limited
data.text: Considering advanced prints from CME Group for gold futures markets, open interest remained choppy and shrank by around 14.3K contracts on Thursday, reversing at the same time the previous daily build. Volume, instead, resumed the uptrend and rose by around 75.5K contracts.

data.title: Gold (XAUUSD) Rallying in a Nesting Elliott Wave Impulse
data.text: Cycle from 11.23.2022 is unfolding as a 5 waves nesting Elliott Wave impulse. Up from 11.23.2022 low, wave ((i)) ended at 1810.04 and pullback in wave ((ii)) ended at 1773.92.
